title: Andy Murray set to play in Australian Open, says tournament director
text:
Andy Murray is expected to compete in the 2020 Australian Open, according to its tournament director, Craig Tiley.

The former world No 1 had career-saving hip surgery earlier this year and continued his good progress by reaching the China Open quarter-finals last week.

John Millman outclassed by Novak Djokovic in Japan Open final Read more

At the 2019 Australian Open, Murray, 32, tearfully announced he may have to retire due to the pain he felt every time he played.

But after he underwent a procedure to resurface his hip joint in January, the two-time Wimbledon champion could be involved in the first grand slam of the new year.

“For sure Andy will be here,” Tiley told the Australian radio station Triple M on Tuesday. “I was on the phone to his agent this morning. He is going to be in Australia early.

“He is ready to return. Remember he said goodbye a year ago. It’s great in that period he had surgery and has rebounded really well.”
description: Andy Murray is expected to compete in the 2020 Australian Open, according to its tournament director, Craig Tiley
